lines.content: > *Chokmah (Hebrew: חָכְמָה, romanized: ḥoḵmā, also transliterated as chokma, chokhmah or hokhma) is the Biblical Hebrew word rendered as "wisdom" in English Bible versions (LXX σοφία sophia, Vulgate sapientia) - [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chokmah)
**Hokmah** is a chatbot that doesn't like you but will:
- [X] Find tasks by deadline (for deadlines and events)
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
2. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
2. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
3. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
3. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

4. After that, locate the `src/main/java/hokmah.Hokmah.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run hokmah.Hokmah.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
## For Java Programmers that want to use Hokmah as a library
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the main method:

Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Hokmah is a task management chatbot that supports four types of tasks: `todo`, `deadline`, `event`. It is designed for users who prefer typing commands to manage their tasks efficiently.
- Download the latest version of Hokmah from the [Hokmah Releases](https://github.com/Ryuse/ip/releases/) page.
- Double-click the downloaded JAR file, or open a terminal and navigate to the directory where the JAR file is located. Then, run the following command:
Adds a todo task with a specified description to the task list.
Now you have 1 tasks in the list! What else do you want?
Adds a deadline task with a specified description and due date to the task list.
Now you have 1 tasks in the list. What else do you want?
Adds an event task with a specified description, start time, and end time to the task list.
- `fromDateTime` and `toDateTime` must be in 24-hour `yyyy-MM-dd HHmm` format.
- The `/from` argument must come before the `/to` argument.
Now you have 3 tasks in the list!
Displays all tasks in the task list.
Finds tasks that contain a specified keyword in their description.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
View upcoming tasks that occur on a specific date.
Your upcoming tasks on Dec 2 2019 are:
You have 1 upcoming task(s). It's coming soon. Like your doom.
Removes a task from the task list using its index.
Ok sure, I've removed this task
Marks a task as complete using its index.
Bleh! I've masked this task as done!
Marks a task as incomplete using its index.
So you have not done this task yet?
That's sad. I've masked it as such.
I hope you don't come back soon!
This guide provides an overview of Hokmah's features and commands. If you have any more questions feel free to contact me, Ryuse.

Seems like this is our first time meeting.
Just what are you going to do?
Can you at least tell me the name?
Can you at least give me a proper index for the command?
Ok? Can you put the deadline command properly?
Can you put when your event will start and end properly?
Can you put when your event will end properly?
Wait, is your event start date seriously after the end date?
The task you are trying to perform an action on cannot be found.
Are you sure you put the right task index?""";
Can you put when want to see the upcoming tasks properly?
Can you specify a search term? You're bad at following commands.
